caption:
Table 
1. D2L outperforms its competitors consistently across all 
datasets and across all noise rates tested. In particular, the 
performance gap between D2L and its competitors increases 

as the noise rate is increased from 20% to 60%. We also 
note that as the noise rate increases, the accuracy drop of 
D2L is the smallest among all models. Even with 60% label 
noise, D2L can still obtain a relatively high classification 
accuracy, which indicates that D2L may have the potential 
to be an effective strategy for semi-supervised learning.
